title: How to Connect the Amazon Kindle Fire to the Internet

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the cog icon on the home screen. [1] X Research source Connecting to Wi-Fi is an important part of setting up your Kindle Fire. This is how you'll get access to the web, apps, games, and more.

steps.title: Tap Internet.
steps.content: Tap Internet . You can find this at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Wi-Fi to toggle it on.
steps.content: Tap Wi-Fi to toggle it on. The toggle will turn orange when enabled. If you have Airplane mode enabled, tap it to turn it off.

steps.title: Tap Wi-Fi preferences.
steps.content: Tap Wi-Fi preferences . This will be below Wi-Fi .

steps.title: Select a Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Select a Wi-Fi network. If you don't see your Wi-Fi network, you may need to troubleshoot your Wi-Fi or restart your tablet .

steps.title: Enter the Wi-Fi password.
steps.content: Enter the Wi-Fi password. Make sure it's the correct password . If the network doesn't require a password or is public, you should be able to connect automatically. When using a public network, avoid logging into important websites to stay safe .

steps.title: Select Connect.
steps.content: Select Connect . You should be connected to the Wi-Fi network. You can now use your Kindle Fire to watch movies, play games, and more.
